text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to make lemon and pistachio tart?
text.Response A:
Place flour, sugar, lemon zest, salt, and butter into a food processor.
Add the egg yolks and lemon juice.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface.
Wrap tightly in plastic.
Gently place it into the baking tin and trim the excess pastry.
Prick the pastry base with a fork.
Cover the pastry with greaseproof paper.
Put the pastry dish in the oven.
Remove the baking beans.
Mix together until smooth.
Transfer the pie gently to the oven.
text.Response B:
Sure, I’d be happy to.  Here are the steps:

1.  Preheat oven to 375 degrees.  In a small bowl, combine sugar, flour, and salt.  In a large bowl, beat together butter and eggs until light and fluffy.  Add sugar mixture and beat well.  Add lemon juice and beat well.  Add nuts and beat well.  Pour into a greased tart pan.  Bake for 30-40 minutes, until set.  Serve with whipped cream.

168.displayed_text:
Prompt

Can you tell me how to make lemon and pistachio tart?

Response A

Place flour, sugar, lemon zest, salt, and butter into a food processor.
Add the egg yolks and lemon juice.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface.
Wrap tightly in plastic.
Gently place it into the baking tin and trim the excess pastry.
Prick the pastry base with a fork.
Cover the pastry with greaseproof paper.
Put the pastry dish in the oven.
Remove the baking beans.
Mix together until smooth.
Transfer the pie gently to the oven.

Response B

Sure, I’d be happy to. Here are the steps:

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl, combine sugar, flour, and salt. In a large bowl, beat together butter and eggs until light and fluffy. Add sugar mixture and beat well. Add lemon juice and beat well. Add nuts and beat well. Pour into a greased tart pan. Bake for 30-40 minutes, until set. Serve with whipped cream.
